Now the commentary of Pelagius is known to have been written before the year 410, and while he was yet at Rome, where Theodore’s work would scarcely have reached him, even if it had then been made public. It seems more probable that Theodore was here and there indebted to Pelagius. The latter took up his abode in Palestine soon after the publication of his com· - mentary; and from Palestine the book might have been conveyed to Antioch and Mopsuestia.
